answers.answer: Hello Mike.I would like to enumerate a few causes here. But this is not a comprehensive list.White matter disease  -Vascular cause ( Ischemia )TumorsVasculitisInfections (e.g. Viral encephalitis)Demyelinating processes -Guillain Barré SyndromeChronic Immune Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP)Toxins (e.g. Diphtheria)Drugs (Chloroquine)Chronic liver diseaseDiabetesThe final diagnosis depends upon the clinical features and certain investigational procedures.Hope everything is fine.Regards

Your service is PHENOMENAL!!  And I appreciate the 'plain English' (th the extent that medicine allows).One of your listings really got my attention:ChloroquineMy wife was treated for cerebral Malaria while we were doing volunteer work in Africa in 1993.  Since you can die so quickly from it they give you the treatment just to see if it helps.  Is Chloroquine a treatment for malaria?  If so, could it affect her 14 years later?  She recently had liver tests before Barnes Hospital in St. Louis administered four days of high doses of Depacon to her IV because they focused on her severe head pain and failed to consider her myriad of other neurological symptoms.  I have not researched CIDP, but I will.  She is currently scheduled for Chiari Malformation (repair) surgery in late January from Dr. Oró, a neurosurgeon specializing in occipital decompression surgery for alleviation of Chiari problems.  My fear is that she has more than just the Chiari problem going on.Thanks for any other input you can give.  You have been GREAT!Mike

Hello Mike.Yes, Chloroquine is a treatment of Malaria. But I suppose 14 years is a long time. Chloroquine seems less likely to be the cause here.She definitely has more than just Chiari. The demyelination has to be explained. I have not seen any cases of chiari malformation with demyelination.This has to be discussed with her Neurologist.Regards

Thank you for your help.  Our current Neurologist specializes in MS, but he has said he does not yet believe she has it.  After an appropriate recuperation from the Chiari surgery we will see what symptoms remain.  If they are intolerable, as they are now, he said he would suggest measuring the CSF pressure and analyzing it for possible MS or other cause of the demylenating process.  If you would like I will try to save this thread to give you an update in three months or so.Thanks again for your fine help.Mike Wenger
